title: Support for sklearn's CalibratedClassifierCV?
body:
Is there a way `CalibratedClassifierCV` can be supported if it is used to wrap any of the supported models by shap? I get an error anytime I try to use it. It would be great if someone knows a workaround to this:
```python
import shap
from sklearn.calibration import CalibratedClassifierCV
from sklearn.datasets import make_classification
from  sklearn.ensemble.gradient_boosting import GradientBoostingClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

X, y = make_classification(n_samples=500)
x_train, x_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(
    X, y, train_size=0.7
)
supported_clf = GradientBoostingClassifier()
calib_model = CalibratedClassifierCV(base_estimator=supported_clf, cv=5)
calib_model.fit(x_train, y_train)

explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(calib_model)
values = explainer.shap_values(x_test)
out = shap.force_plot(
    explainer.expected_value,
    values[1],
    x_test[[1]]
)
```

I get this error:
`Exception: Model type not yet supported by TreeExplainer: <class 'sklearn.calibration.CalibratedClassifierCV'>`

If I change the line `explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(calib_model)` to `explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(calib_model.base_estimator)`, shap will detect the supported classfier but then it will not be fit so I get a new error: `AttributeError: 'GradientBoostingClassifier' object has no attribute 'estimators_'` (since base_estimator has not been explicitly fitted.)

Even if option B worked, it still would defeat the purpose of of using the `CalibratedClassifierCV` class.
